show_description:
notes at
http://xahlee.info/talk_show/xah_talk_show_2024-09-17.html

note, there is an error.
in the function directory-files-recursively, to skip dir name starting with a dot,
the proper predicate is
(lambda (x) (not (string-match-p "/\\." x)))
because the function is passed a subdirectory full path, not just name.

show_title: XahTV 2021-06-26, emacs lisp create hook, dark theme sucks
show_description:
• [Elisp: Create a Hook] ( http://ergoemacs.org/emacs/emacs_create_hook.html )

the problem of dark theme.
• dark theme is over rated.
• there is no automated way to create a dark theme from light theme. you actually have to design every color on a website or your app.
• even if you have the right colors, simply changing color set may effect your user interface userbility. For example, window border shadow.
• dark theme is actually more difficult to read.
• human eyes, actually read better, of black text on white background. because it is more natural, e.g. when you go outside in daylight. and they've done scientific test on this.
• just buy a great display. which has adjustable blue light filter .

• [User Interface Design] ( http://xahlee.info/js/web_design_index.html )
• [Windows 10 Flat Design Sucks] ( http://xahlee.info/w/flat_ui.html )
• [Web Design: Grey Text on White Background] ( http://xahlee.info/js/web_design_gray_on_white.html )

show_title: xah talk show 2021-04-19 emacs lisp. explore ido and helm fuzzy match source code. part 2.
show_description:
We are going to explore the elisp source code of helm and ido mode, to see how they implement fuzzy matching.

First, we write a emacs command, that lets user choose from potentially thousands of academic phrases. Using ido mode's character based fuzzy matching. 10 minutes.
Helm uses a word based fuzzy matching, and order of words does not matter.
If our elisp exploration of helm source code is successful, we are going to modify our code to use helm's fuzzy matching.

Part one at:
http://xahlee.info/talk_show/xah_talk_show_2021-04-18.html

Topics:
• Write a command that let user select from predefined list of choices. Using ido mode's fuzzy matching.
• Explain what the type of fuzzy matching ido is using.
• Explain that we want a word based fuzzy matching, and order does not matter.
• Explore helm M-x to see how it works.
• Optional: see how ido implements fuzzy matching.

show_title: Xah Talk Show 2020-08-04, emacs lisp coding, open buffer or link in chrome
show_description:
• Thanks to my patreons.
• combine 「xah-html-open-in-chrome-browser」, 「xah-html-open-link-in-chrome」
• 「xah-html-youtube-linkify」
• commands to view command log and key • 「command-log-mode」 • 「view-lossage」 • keyfreq.el」
•  〈Practical Emacs Lisp〉 [ http://ergoemacs.org/emacs/elisp.html ]

(defun xah-html-open-in-chrome ()
  "Open current buffer or link under cursor in Google Chrome browser.
If cursor position is link/url, open that link. Else, open current buffer.
Version 2020-08-04"
  (interactive)
  (let ((filePath (thing-at-point 'filename )) )
    (if filePath
        (xah-html-open-link-in-chrome)
      (xah-html-open-in-chrome-browser))))

story of math crisis, math foundation, proof theory, and homotopy type theory
show_description:
At 1:02:45, my explanation of “law of excluded middle” is incorrect.
What i said there is “principle of bivalence”, which mean a proposition is either true or false.
Law of Excluded Middle is the principle for believing the validity of Proof By Contradiction, at 1:14:16.
Intuitionist do not believe Law of Excluded Middle, thus do not buy any proof done by contradiction.

math crisis in history:
• discovery of irrational numbers.
• discovery of negative number?
• discovery of complex numbers.
• discovery of non-euclidean geometry.
• discovery of countable and non-countable infinity.
• godel's theory

schools of thought:
• formalism
• logicism
• intuitionism (contructivism)
bleeding edge: homotopy type theory

show_title: Xah Talk 2019-07-19 lisp syntax, s-exp, meta-expression, Mathematica, meaning of sugar syntax
show_description:
topics covered:
• racket2 is planning a new syntax
• What is lisp? the characteristics of lisp.
• lisp syntax is actually not 100% regular.
• meaning of lisp “code is data”, aka Homoiconicity. This is actually ill defined. this term became popular around 2008. you see that lots of other languages not based on nested bracket, also qualify as Homoiconic. The heart of the lisp concept “code is data”, is actually regularity of nested syntax.
• example of 100% regular nested brackets syntax: Mathematica.
• the practical problems of purely nested syntax.
• emacs. why not use calc? because, using a real programing language (any python ruby JavaScript) in a full text editor is simpler, more flexble, more powerful.
• what is meta expression, aka mexp.
• the confusion of the concept “sugar syntax”, and the meaning of “syntactically equivalence”

Links:
• racket2 syntax proposal  [ https://github.com/racket/racket/wiki/Racket2 ]
•  〈LISP Infix Syntax Survey〉 [ http://xahlee.info/comp/lisp_sans_sexp.html ]
